intro: Aruba salubris, commonly known as the Aruban health plant, is a flowering plant native to the island of Aruba. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture, and it thrives in well-drained sandy soils. It is often found growing along coastal areas and in dry, sunny habitats. Due to its unique appearance and local significance, it is considered an important part of Aruba's botanical heritage.
